trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Sorting"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Sorting> event when a Sort button is clicked, but before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control handles the sort operation.

(A Sort button is a button whose `CommandName` property set to "Sort".) This enables you to provide an event-handling method that performs a custom routine whenever this event occurs, such as customizing the sort expression.
A ListViewSortEventArgs object is passed to the event-handling method.
This object enables you to specify or determine the sort expression and sort direction for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
To determine the sort expression, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSortEventArgs.SortExpression%2A> property.
To determine the sort direction, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSortEventArgs.SortDirection%2A> property.
You can also cancel a sorting operation by setting the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the ListViewSortEventArgs class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSelectEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSortEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSortEventArgs> class.
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is primarily used by control developers when they raise events.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSortEventArgs> class.

|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSortEventArgs.SortExpression%2A>|The value of the `sortExpression` parameter.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewSortEventArgs.SortDirection%2A>|The value of the `sortDirection` parameter.|
The sort expression that is used to sort the items in the control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SortDirection"></xref> value that indicates the direction in which to sort the items in the control.
Gets or sets the direction in which to sort the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Sorting> event is raised, you can use the SortDirection property to specify or determine the order in which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control will sort items.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SortDirection"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the expression that is used to sort the items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView.Sorting> event is raised, you can use the SortExpression property to specify the sort expression that will be used to sort the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
The sort expression contains the name of the field to sort.
You can also sort multiple columns at a time by programmatically setting this property to a comma-separated list of field names.
> [!NOTE] > By default, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control applies the sort direction to the complete list of columns.
As a result, the sort direction applies to only the last column in the list.
The expression that is used to sort the items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView"></xref> control.
